content.description: Start on the sloping edge shared by Big Man on Campus and follow the holds right and up. This problem requires shorter ticky tacky moves on the many small foot and hand holds, and can be a little tricky to figure out. If you start higher on small sidepulls it's a V3.
content.location: North side of the Campus Boulder

content.description: Sit down start on the crack and do one hard move.
content.location: The next line to the right of Johny's Campus Problem

content.description: Good moves following the right slanting feature
A really cool dyno move off of small crimps. Â Start with obvious foothold and small holds just left of The Butt
content.location: Starts on two crimps just left of The Butt

content.description: Start hanging from two really bad slopers, campus to the flat lip and mantel.
content.location: On the west side of the Campus Boulder

content.description:
This is a nice boulder problem with perfect, water polished rock and interesting technical moves.

Sit start with both hands on the slopey butt feature.  Make a big move up to a small undercling, stand up, and slap for the arete out right.  Work you feet, reach for a decent crimp in the dihedral and keep it together for an easy topout.

Fun problem in a beautiful setting.

Great problem to work alone.  The first move is the hardest, and the landing is perfectly flat and sandy.
content.protection: A few pads.  The landing is perfectly flat and sandy.
content.location: On the stream side(East) of the boulder.  Between the "Mom and Nikko 4evr" and the "Julie e Jorge Forever" graffiti.

content.description: Start on a good sloping edge, move left to a blocky left-facing feature, then continue up and left with a couple of really cool moves to an easy mantel.  Super fun, a canyon classic for the grade.
content.location: On the north side of the Campus Boulder, to the right of/above the big overhang.
